additionalTextInformation.text:
In a recent auction catalogue entry it is suggested that this fragment may have originally been part of a paintng depicting 'Hercules and Omphale' now in Aschaffenburg [DE_MSA_12578].

[See Hampel online database, accessed 25.09.2020](https://www.hampel-auctions.com/a/Lucas-Cranach-d-Ae-1472-1553.html?a=119&s=656&id=555229)

[see also DK_SMK_KMSsp727 for similar female head]

pageContext.description:
This panel is a fragment from a larger composition, possibly a depiction of ‘Hercules and Omphale’. It shows a woman in three quarter profile, looking to her right. She is wearing a gown with a fur collar and has a decorative gold band around her neck as well as a large linked chain. Her hair is pinned up and concealed beneath a white bonnet.
[cda 2020]
